All counts are randomly rounded to a multiple of 3 using the following procedure: counts that are already a multiple of 3 are not adjusted; counts 1 greater than a multiple of 3 are adjusted to the next lowest multiple of 3 with a probability of two-thirds and to the next highest multiple of 3 with a probability of one-third. The probabilities are reversed for counts that are 1 less than a multiple of 3.
Totals may not add up to the sum of all categories due to rounding.
The data are subject to revision.
Counts represent the number of students enrolled in programs at the beginning of the school year (in September or as close as possible thereafter), as provided by the provinces and territories.
In British Columbia, most private/independent school graduates from General programs for adults" are reported in the enrolments for "Regular programs for youth"."
Public elementary and secondary schools are publicly funded schools that are operated by school boards or the province/territory.

Private/independent elementary and secondary schools are operated, managed and administered by private individuals and/or groups. The extent to which an institution receives its funding from public or private sources does not determine its classification as a public or private/independent school.
Home-schooling" is an alternative method of learning that takes place outside the public or private school environment; parents have the primary responsibility of managing
